com.engine.gameObject

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engine.gameObject.GameObject

  • public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object

    Description:

    A game object is anything in the game that can move or be interacted with in the game world. Anything that requires more features than the basics of a game object should be a separate class that extends this one. For example, Player.java or Tile.java.

    Basic Functionality:

    The base functionality of a game object is as follows:
    • X and Y positions in the game world
    • X and Y velocities that control movement
    • The ability to fall downwards in the Y direction due to gravity
    • Basic collisions with other game objects and tiles
    • The ability to be clicked on and perform an action
    Author:
    Ryan Hochmuth
